title: Riot Art
body:
Hi There!

So I've been wondering, does anyone know what tools Riot uses to make their splash art? I've been looking at them and wanting to make one like it for a while now, but I've got no idea how. So does anyone know the program they use, and have any tutorials for the type of art they do? 

Thanks!

P.S: I know they made art spotlights a while ago, I'm not talking about those for a few reasons.
1) They're old
2) There just a time-lapse of them from a starting drawing/image already, and I'd prefer a tutorial.

replies.body:
Hey Time Criminal!

Lord Sesshomaru is right! Though the art team uses a variety of tools, Photoshop is a core when it comes to splash art. You would definitely need a drawing tablet or something though unless you are a GOD with a mouse :P You can find a lot of tutorials on Youtube by other artists just search up "digital painting" to get started.

If you've already got some drawing skills, you will definitely pick it up faster. If you're new to illustration, my advice is to invest more time into pencil+paper first.

Beyond that, most of (if not all) the animated splash arts for login screens/screensavers etc are made with Adobe AfterEffects. If you want to learn about that, search "AfterEffects puppet" in Youtube.

:)
Holy moly, the puppet tool is pretty legit! Thanks for the insight!

Thanks :D

EDIT: Found a really good tutorial series. Thanks for the help :)

They definitely will use Photoshop _(at least for the main bulk)_, It's the go-to digital painting software, and I remember seeing a post saying it was one of the softwares the artists use to paint. 

_(also the art spotlights your are talking about are definitely done on photoshop (albeit an older version), I recognise the layout)_

I highly doubt riot themselves will have any tutorials on creating the artworks, I certainly haven't seen any, and I've watched a lot of their videos.
But there will be plenty of tutorials from other youtubers using the same program and painting in similar styles.


But definitely don't expect an easy road!
The splash artists at riot are the best of the best, not only do they have years and years of practice, but will have a great artistic eye. 

This is one of the images I did when I tried my hand at digital painting:
http://img13.deviantart.net/2554/i/2015/129/6/1/the_face_of_love_by_sixpathsrinnegan-d8spe1b.jpg

 I traced the outline from an anime character, not to mention I was already very familiar with photoshop, and it still took me a couple of weeks. **and it's terrible! :S**

So It won't be a easy, but with practice you can definitely do it!

Pretty sure they use industry standard programs such as Adobe animate and possibly photoshop, if you want to learn more about their splash art animations I suggest searching for photoshop or flash gifs and looking for tutorials there :)
